questions.title: Overall rating (1 very bad - 4 very good):
Steps to be completed before the ballot-boxes are opened
subquestion: 1c: Were the people queuing in front of the PS allowed to vote?
2c: Was the seal on the ballot boxes intact before opening the boxes?
3c: Was the seal’s serial entered into the protocol?
4c: Were the control sheets found in every ballot box and identical with the one kept by the PSO?
5c: Was the number of votes announced and entered into the protocols?
6c: Was the number of unused ballot boxes entered into the protocols?
7c: Was the number of spoiled votes counted and entered into the protocol?
8c: Were spoiled and unused ballots packed in separate envelopes?

questions.title: Officials and transparency
subquestion: 9c: Is the count performed only by polling-station officials?
10c: Do election officials appear to understand and adhere to the required procedures?
11c: Are ballots counted in an orderly and secure manner?
12c: Is the count conducted in a transparent environment?
13c: Are observers able to clearly see all aspects of the counting, including marks on ballots?
14c: Does the number of registered voters recorded as having voted correspond with the number of ballots cast?

questions.title: Opening of the ballot boxes
subquestion: 15c: Are unused ballots secured, cancelled or destroyed after being counted?
16c: Are ballots invalidated in a reasonable and consistent manner?
17c: Are invalid ballots appropriately segregated and preserved for review?
18c: Does the number of invalid ballots seem inordinately high?
19c: Do the ballots contain any unusual markings intended to violate the secrecy of the vote?
20c: Are ballots for each party or candidate separated correctly and counted individually?
21c: Did polling-station officials agree on the vote-counting procedures and results?
22c: If there were any disputes or complaints, were they resolved in a satisfactory manner?
23c: Are official counting records appropriately completed?
24c: Are political party/candidate representatives and other domestic observers able to obtain official copies of the protocol for the polling station?
25c: Are the results posted publicly or transparently in the polling station?
26c: Are there inappropriate activities by police and/or security forces personnel, such as taking notes and reporting figures or results by telephone?

questions.title: Irregularities
subquestion: 27c: Do you see any indications of ballot box-stuffing?
28c: Do you see any indications of adding marked ballots after the opening of the box?
29c: Do you see any indications of attempting to invalidate ballot papers?
30c: Do you see any indications of multiple and identical signatures on the voter list?
31c: Does the polling station have an inadequate numbers of counting staff and supervisors?
32c: Do you see any indications of exclusion of polling-station officials or observers?
33c: Do you see any indications of power outages that hamper or prevent counting?
34c: Are observers kept at too great a distance to see marked ballots and how they are sorted?
35c: Do you see any indications of dishonest counting or reporting of the ballots?
36c: Do you see any indications of insecure storage of unused ballots?

questions.title: Procedures and environment
subquestion: 37c: Were the PSO disturbed in their work counting the ballots?
38c: Were the PSO members’ understanding of counting procedures followed in a satisfactory manner?
39c: Was the overall performance of the PSO satisfactory?
40c: Was the transparency of the counting process satisfactory?
